bug.author: jmozah
bug.summary: Old jobs lost after DIGITS upgrade
bug.description: I pulled the new version of DIGITS today and restarted DIGITS. Saw some logs like below Upgrading ImageClassificationDatasetJob to version 2 Upgrading CreateDbTask to version 2 Upgrading CreateDbTask to version 3 Upgrading CreateDbTask to version 2 Upgrading CreateDbTask to version 3 and finally the jobs dont show up in DIGITS anymore... it looks as if i started clean slate... They are present in "jobs" directory though. Any chance of recovering them?

comments.comment: Ugh, I tested that repeatedly. The upgrade path should have worked. You can try setting on <denchmark-link:https://github.com/NVIDIA/DIGITS/blob/v1.1.0/digits/scheduler.py#L30>this line</denchmark-link> - that may tell you that there's something simple that needs to be changed. But I fear you probably won't be able to recover your old jobs without some pretty complicated trickery. Do you know which version of the code (which commit) you had previously, and which version you have now? Or at least a general idea? This needs to be fixed.
i didnt keep a note... i deleted the old volume... i will keep a track of that from now..

I'll test the upgrade paths again to make sure I didn't just miss something obvious, but I doubt I'll come up with anything. It would be super helpful if you could try this out and see if you get any more information for me (no worries if you can't/won't):
rm -r ~/.digits - clean out old configuration, jobs git checkout digits-1.0 ./digits-devserver Create a dataset and model like you did before. Hopefully just a simple test will do. You can get the MNIST set using tools/download_data/main.py if you haven't checked that out already. Shut down the server git checkout v1.1.0 Edit this line to say verbose=True ./digits-devserver See if you get any detailed error messages about what went wrong.

Oh really? Thanks for checking that. You're supposed to be able to move the folders around without getting errors, but I haven't tested it in a while. I'll look into it.
Should be fixed now. Thanks for investigating.
